CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper December 13, 1941, pg. 16, reads: "Here are the Harlem Globetrotters, famous professional quintet, ready for a busy season of play and traveling. Back row, left to right: Strong, Pressley, Price and Marcel. First row: Wilcox, Pittsburgh 'Y' star, who is getting a trial with the 'Trotter; Hudson, Ford and Jones."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Original Harlem Globetrotters basketball team wearing uniform patches reading "Chicago $15,000 World's Pro Cage Tourney," front row from left: Ted Strong Jr., Tony Wilcox, Roosevelt Hudson, Ford, William Jones; back row: Louis "Babe" Pressley, Bernie Price, and Everett Marcell
